Class Server

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class Server
extends javax.swing.JFrame
the Server class is used to retrieve data from the database through WordleModel and send it to clients that need it
Author:
Sam Maschmann
See Also:
Client, ServerDriver, WordleModel, Serialized Form

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void checkUserAvail​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    checkUserAvail takes a String array that contains a username and check with the database to see if the player has played in the tournament today.
    static void checkWord​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    checkWord takes a string array that contains a guess and a round number and checks how many letters are in the correct position, how many are in the incorrect position, and how many are not in the word at all It sends back a packet with 5 ints varying between 0 and 2, where 2 is correct position, 1 exists in the word, but incorrect position, and 0 is not in the word
    static void checkWordValid​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    checkWordValid takes a string array containing a 5-length string and checks with the database to make sure that it is a valid word
    private void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message)
    This method displays a given message to the display area on the server window
    static void getDailyWord​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    getDailyWord sends a packet containing a requested daily word
    static void getTopFiveAllTime​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    getTopFiveAllTime sends in a packet the top five all time scores and the players that earned them from the database
    static void getTopFiveLeaderboard​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    getTopFiveLeaderboard takes a string array containing a date and checks with the database to send back a packet containing the top 5 users with their scores
    static void getUserScore​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    getUserScore takes a String array containing a username and a date and sends a packet with the score for that user on that date
    static void getUserStats​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    getUserStats takes a string array containing a username and sends in a packet some statistics, including total score, total rounds played, and winning streak
    void sendPacket​(java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket)
    This method takes a packet from a client, reads what is being requested, and sends the requested data to client from whence it came
    static void uploadScore​(java.lang.String[] dataArray)
    uploadScore takes a string array containing a username and a series of numbers corresponding to how many guesses each daily word took It then calculates a score and uploads it to the database
    void waitForPackets()
    This method is constantly being run by the server to wait to receive packets from clients

      The Socket to communicate with the clients

      The area to display messages on the server window

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server()
      This is the main constructor for the server. It initializes the instance variables

  • Method Details

    • waitForPackets

      public void waitForPackets()
      This method is constantly being run by the server to wait to receive packets from clients

    • sendPacket

      public void sendPacket​(java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      This method takes a packet from a client, reads what is being requested, and sends the requested data to client from whence it came
      Parameters:
      inPacket - A packet from a client in this format: "#,input" where # is a number telling which type of data is needed, and input is the given data from the client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkUserAvail

      public static void checkUserAvail​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      checkUserAvail takes a String array that contains a username and check with the database to see if the player has played in the tournament today. It sends back a packet with "1" if the user is eligible, and "0" if not
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a String array in the form of [1,username] where username is the username
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkWord

      public static void checkWord​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      checkWord takes a string array that contains a guess and a round number and checks how many letters are in the correct position, how many are in the incorrect position, and how many are not in the word at all It sends back a packet with 5 ints varying between 0 and 2, where 2 is correct position, 1 exists in the word, but incorrect position, and 0 is not in the word
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a String array in the form of [2,guess,round] where guess is a string to be tested against a daily word, and round is a number telling which word to test it against
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getDailyWord

      public static void getDailyWord​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      getDailyWord sends a packet containing a requested daily word
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the form [3,round] where round tells which daily word is being requested
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkWordValid

      public static void checkWordValid​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      checkWordValid takes a string array containing a 5-length string and checks with the database to make sure that it is a valid word
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the form of [4,word] where word is a string to be tested to be a word
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • uploadScore

      public static void uploadScore​(java.lang.String[] dataArray)
      uploadScore takes a string array containing a username and a series of numbers corresponding to how many guesses each daily word took It then calculates a score and uploads it to the database
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the form [5,username,guesses] where username is the username and guesses is a string of five ints ranging from 1-7

    • getTopFiveLeaderboard

      public static void getTopFiveLeaderboard​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      getTopFiveLeaderboard takes a string array containing a date and checks with the database to send back a packet containing the top 5 users with their scores
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the format [6,date] where date is the date that the leaderboard is being requested
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getUserScore

      public static void getUserScore​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      getUserScore takes a String array containing a username and a date and sends a packet with the score for that user on that date
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the format [7,username,date], where username is the user and date is the date
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getUserStats

      public static void getUserStats​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      getUserStats takes a string array containing a username and sends in a packet some statistics, including total score, total rounds played, and winning streak
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the form [8,user] where user is a username
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getTopFiveAllTime

      public static void getTopFiveAllTime​(java.lang.String[] dataArray, java.net.DatagramPacket inPacket) throws java.io.IOException
      getTopFiveAllTime sends in a packet the top five all time scores and the players that earned them from the database
      Parameters:
      dataArray - a string array in the form [9]
      inPacket - the packet that came from the place where the data will be sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • displayMessage

      private void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      This method displays a given message to the display area on the server window
      Parameters:
      message - a String to be displayed on the window
